sentences.en: A covetous man do nothing well till he dies.
A covetous man is good to none but worse to himself.
sentences.cn: 贪婪之徒,与世无益,尤害自身.

sentences.en: A poor man wants some things , a covetous man all things.
sentences.cn: 穷人需求不多,财迷想要一切.

sentences.en: As the saying goes, A covetous man is ever in want.
sentences.cn: 俗云: “贪婪的人永远想要更多. ”

sentences.en: Even here a red Lamborghini Diablo sports car attracts covetous stares.
sentences.cn: 即便在这儿，兰博基尼的红色迪亚博罗跑车也会招来垂涎的目光。

sentences.en: He cast a covetous eye at the that small fortune.
sentences.cn: 他对那份小小家产垂涎三尺.

sentences.en: He raised his head, with a look of unrestrained greed in his covetous eyes.
sentences.cn: 他抬起头来, 一对贪婪的眼光露出馋涎欲滴的神情.

sentences.en: He was casting covetous eyes at the company.
She is envious of Jane's good looks and covetous of her car.
sentences.cn: 她既忌妒简的美貌又垂涎她的汽车.

sentences.en: She owns a house at the seaside . Covetous of learning.
sentences.cn: 她在海滨拥有自己的房子.

sentences.en: The guy is covetous of power.
The two boxers cast covetous eyes on each other.
sentences.cn: 两位拳击手虎视耽耽地对视着.

sentences.en: Therefore there was great enmity between this covetous Jew and the generous merchant Antonio.
sentences.cn: 因此,这个贪婪的犹太人就跟慷慨的商人安东尼奥结下了很深的仇恨.

sentences.en: They began to cast covetous eyes on their neighbours’ fields.
sentences.cn: 他们开始觊觎邻居的土地。

sentences.en: They were opionative, peevish, covetous, porase, vain, talkative.
sentences.cn: 他们固执 、 暴躁 、 贪婪 、 乖僻 、 虚荣, 多嘴.

sentences.en: When Mary anointed the Saviour's feet, Judas manifested his covetous disposition.
sentences.cn: 及至马利亚用香膏抹救主的脚时, 犹大才显出他贪婪的性情来.

trans.tran_cn: <贬>贪婪的，垂涎的，狼贪虎视，爱财，馋
trans.tran_en: having a very strong desire to have something that someone else has
